content: - 14 -   settled, as are a host of other related questions, including the following:  Do U.S.   monetary policy actions affect advanced and emerging market countries differently?  Do   conventional and unconventional monetary policies spill over to other countries   differently?  And to what extent are U.S. interest rates and financial conditions influenced   by easing measures abroad?     Conclusion   In closing, I would like to commend the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston for   organizing this conference and fostering research and debate on questions vital to our   understanding of the economy.  Answering these questions will help the Federal   Reserve’s efforts to promote a healthy economy, and I am grateful for the opportunity to   speak to you today and be part of this important discussion.
